timeseries¶

roipy.timeseries Module¶

SBAS timeseries code in python

class roipy.timeseries.Timeseries(Set, runDirectory)¶
associate_files()¶

Files output by matlab routines

filter(date=None, IG=None)¶

Convenience Method, Identical to Set.omit(IG=igList)

filter_baselines(minBperp=130, listFile=None)¶

Omit any interferograms that have a perp baseline greater than ‘thresh’. Need list.out from dolist.m script... thresh=130m from Berardino 2002 SBAS paper

filter_timespans(minTime=2.0)¶

Omit any interferograms less than ‘minTime’ years

get_coverage()¶

Generate data quality map

invert(method='svd')¶

Call desired inversion method ‘svd’ ‘wdls’ ‘svd_l1’

invert_L1_svd()¶

SBAS time series inversion using L1 norm reference: Lauknes et. al. 2011 IEEE Transaction on Geoscience and Remote Sensing

invert_L2_svd()¶

SBAS time series inversion using L2 norm reference: Berardino et. al. 2002 IEEE Transaction on Geoscience and Remote Sensing

invert_L2_wdls()¶

perform time series inversion

load_files()¶

Save .unw phase (unwraped & converted to LOS displacement) and .msk coherence arrays as .npy binary files in subfolders of timeseries run

load_ma(Interferogram)¶

open phase and mask arrays in .npy format and return a numpy masked array

load_settings(outfile='settings.p')¶

Load previous settings from pickled dictionary

load_signal_mask(path)¶

Custom mask identifying known signal in an interferogram 0=unknown 1=known signal

make_B()¶

make velocity connectivity matrix

mask_border(left=3, right=3, top=3, bottom=3)¶

because edge pixels are often nonsense, remove specified number of pixels from the edges. Note that up=3 will remove 4 pixels from the top of the interferogram since python indexing starts at 0

mask_gradient(override=False)¶

use np.gradient() to get rid of isolated unwrapping errors (surrounded by nans and edge effects

mask_incoherent()¶

mask pixel values that have coherence values in .msk file less than specified threshold. 0=incoherent, 1=fully coherent

mask_sparse(threshold=10)¶

mask pixels that are not coherent in more than <threshold> interferograms in a set

plot_ig(num=0, name=None)¶
prep_matlab()¶

Write defaults.m needed for running the matlab timeseries scripts written by Paul Lundgren & Noah Finnegan

remove_ramp(addmask=False)¶

Remove a quadratic surface from the interferogram (e.g. residual ramps left over after re-estimating baselines in ROI_PAC). Subtracting the best-fit quadratic surface forces the mean surface displacement to be zero (equal amount of positive & negative deformation within the scene). Therefore it is CRITICAL to exclude known signal and unwrapping errors before running this function!

run_all()¶
save_ma(Interferogram, mask_array)¶

save a masked array as a data array and logical array in .npy format. Prepend an optional prefix if desired

save_settings(outfile='settings.p')¶

Save timeseries settings to input file

save_signal_mask(outpath, regions=[(250, 350, 0, 100)])¶

regions is a list of tuples (left,right,top,bottom)

unfilter(date=None, IG=None)¶

Convenience method to Set.remit(IG=igList)
